text:
Q: what's the current best way to put audio and video on a web site? A:

For mp3, if it is a speech or just human talking about something, you don't need to make stereo, mono is more than enough. You can edit using Audacity (free-open source software). I guest (from my past experience) 1 hour speech could be 5-6 MB mono mp3 (about 96Kbps i want to post

Q: Adjusting ggplot2 label intervals A:

This can be indirectly addressed by defining a function:

ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, z = density)) +
  geom_contour_filled(breaks = seq(0, 0.04,length.out= 10)) + 
  scale_fill_discrete(palette = scales::pal_brewer(palette = "Blues"),
                     labels =  function(x) {
                       x[seq_along(x) %% 2 != 0] <- ""
                       return(x)}) + 
  guides(fill = guide_colorsteps(show.limits = TRUE, position = 'bottom'))+
  theme(legend.key.width = unit(40, 'pt'))

Q: R sscanf equivalent A:

More of a side-note as read.table example was already provided.
There are also typed configuration formats. So if INI is only for your own R CLI scripts and refactoring is an option, TOML would provide few (somewhat more verbose) alternatives for storing (typed) lists and tables. For example TOML arrays or inline tables or arrays of inline tables (table as in dictionary or R named list)

tmp.toml:
FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_array_of_inline_tables = [
  { ID = "SPIX", ACTIVE = true,  NORM = 0, SAMPLES = 1000, FILE = "${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER" },
  { ID = "GRAY", ACTIVE = false, NORM = 1, SAMPLES = 2000, FILE = "${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif" },
  { ID = "VVIX", ACTIVE = true,  NORM = 0, SAMPLES = 1000, FILE = "${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif" }
]

[FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_inline_tables]
SPIX = { ACTIVE = true,  NORM = 0, SAMPLES = 1000, FILE = "${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER" }
GRAY = { ACTIVE = false, NORM = 1, SAMPLES = 2000, FILE = "${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif" }
VVIX = { ACTIVE = true,  NORM = 0, SAMPLES = 1000, FILE = "${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif" }


[FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_arrays]
HDR = ["ACTIVE", "NORM", "SAMPLES", "FILE"]
SPIX = [ [true], [0], [1000], ["${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER"] ]
GRAY = [ [false],[1], [2000], ["${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif"] ]
VVIX = [ [true], [0], [1000], ["${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif"] ]

library(configr)
toml_cfg <- read.config(file = "tmp.toml")
# or RcppTOML::parseToml("tmp.toml") to fail in case of parsing errors

cfg.get.table_aot <- function(config, section){
  dplyr::bind_rows(config[[section]])
}
cfg.get.table_aot(toml_cfg, "FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_array_of_inline_tables")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   ACTIVE FILE                                      ID     NORM SAMPLES
#>   <lgl>  <chr>                                     <chr> <int>   <int>
#> 1 TRUE   ${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER                  SPIX      0    1000
#> 2 FALSE  ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif       GRAY      1    2000
#> 3 TRUE   ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif VVIX      0    1000

cfg.get.table_inln_tbl <- function(config, section){
  dplyr::bind_rows(config[[section]], .id = "id")
}
cfg.get.table_inln_tbl(toml_cfg, "FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_inline_tables")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   id    ACTIVE FILE                                       NORM SAMPLES
#>   <chr> <lgl>  <chr>                                     <int>   <int>
#> 1 GRAY  FALSE  ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif           1    2000
#> 2 SPIX  TRUE   ${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER                      0    1000
#> 3 VVIX  TRUE   ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif     0    1000

cfg.get.table_arr <- function(config, section, header = "HDR"){
  toml_array <- config[[section]]
  lapply(toml_array[names(toml_array) != header], setNames, toml_array[[header]]) |> 
    dplyr::bind_rows(.id = "id")
}
cfg.get.table_arr(toml_cfg, "FEATURE_GRAY_MIN_arrays")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   id    ACTIVE  NORM SAMPLES FILE                                     
#>   <chr> <lgl>  <int>   <int> <chr>                                    
#> 1 GRAY  FALSE      1    2000 ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-gn.tif      
#> 2 SPIX  TRUE       0    1000 ${/PROCESS/SPIXEL.RASTER                 
#> 3 VVIX  TRUE       0    1000 ${/PATH/INCOMING}/ge-feature-b3n-vdni.tif

Q: prisma Error: p1001: Can't reach database server at `db.xocheossqzkirwnhzxxm.supabase.co`:`5432` A:

I have encountered this error for a long long time now and have tried all the solutions possible, but what works for me today is that i went to my Postgres database then clicked on connect, under it you'll see options like Connection String, App frameworks, Mobile Frameworks, ORM, MCP, if you're using Prisma click on the ORM then copy the connection string from there, then Boom, That's it.

Q: rotation matrix for sensor Body-axis to UAV Body-axis Conversion A:

This is not actually a coding question. It is kind of more like a concept question, related to flight control.
